articles.author: Brian Melley
articles.description: A summit of European leaders to discuss Ukraine's defense has been overshadowed by the diplomatic row at the White House. The meeting in London on Sunday has taken on new importance since talks broke down between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday. British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says he’s determined to find an end to Russia’s war on Ukraine as he hosts the gathering to discuss shoring up defenses across Europe. The meeting was supposed to cap a week of diplomacy by France and Britain to bring Trump closer to Ukraine as he talks with Russia about ending the war.
articles.title: White House row with Ukraine raises stakes for European summit in London

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Britain is hosting a summit of European leaders to shore up support for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy after an astonishing Oval Office blowout with President Donald Trump that left many uncertain where the once staunch allies stood. The London meeting on Sunday has now taken on greater importance in defending the war-torn ally and boosting the continent’s defenses. British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, who will welcome leaders of more than a dozen countries and other officials to the gathering, embraced Zelenskyy on his arrival in London on Saturday, saying he is determined to find an end to Russia’s war on Ukraine.
articles.title: The Latest: Britain is hosting a summit of European leaders to shore up support for Zelenskyy

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Key Republicans and Democrats have been stalwart supporters of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. But a blowup between the Ukrainian leader and President Donald Trump is threatening to change that. Zelenskyy had traveled to Washington to sign a deal Friday that would give the U.S. access to its mineral riches as Trump attempts to pressure Ukraine into a deal to end the war with Russia. Instead, the fallout from a heated Oval Office exchange between Trump, Zelenskyy and Vice President JD Vance further splintered American political support for Ukraine. Sen. Lindsey Graham, who has backed Ukraine, called the meeting a “complete, utter disaster."
articles.title: What US lawmakers are saying about the White House clash between Trump and Zelenskyy

articles.author: Justin Spike
articles.description: Ukrainians have rallied around President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as a defender of their country’s interests in the hours after he left the White House after an astonishing Oval Office blowout with President Donald Trump. Trump and Vice President JD Vance berated Zelenskyy during an Oval Office meeting on Friday for what they saw as a lack of gratitude for past U.S. aid, a confrontation that pleased Moscow. The friction cast doubt on future U.S. support for Ukraine amid its war with Russia. But despite the diplomatic fallout, many Ukrainians supported Zelenskyy’s firm stance. Officials across Ukraine praised their leader's resilience, while some cautioned against losing crucial U.S. backing.
articles.title: Ukrainians rally around Zelenskyy as defender of national interest after Oval Office blowout

articles.author: Zeke Miller
articles.description: President Donald Trump’s Oval Office thrashing of Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy has laid bare the limits of a full-court press by America’s allies aimed at reshaping Trump’s determination to end Russia’s invasion even if the terms are not to Ukraine’s liking. It also shows the profound ways Trump feels emboldened to redirect U.S. foreign policy priorities toward his “America First” agenda in ways that extend well beyond those of his tumultuous first term. The episode has left in doubt the future of the U.S.-Ukraine relationship, and Kyiv’s ability to defend itself in the brutal conflict with Russia.
articles.title: Trump's Oval Office thrashing of Zelenskyy shows limits of Western allies' ability to sway US leader

articles.author: Adriana Gomez Licon
articles.description: President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance had a heated exchange with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in the Oval Office over the war in Ukraine, accusing him of not showing gratitude after he challenged Vance on the question of diplomacy with Russia’s Vladimir Putin. The argument, broadcast globally on Friday, was perhaps unique in American history. It led to the rest of Zelenskyy’s White House visit being canceled and called into question how much the U.S. will still support Ukraine in its defense against Russia’s 2022 invasion.
articles.title: A transcript of Trump and Zelenskyy's Oval Office argument

articles.author: Nicholas Riccardi
articles.description: During his first six weeks in office, President Donald Trump has worked to tear down the federal government and attack long-standing institutions. He's undertaken a purge at the FBI and Department of Justice. He's forced out federal officials who are responsible for overseeing ethics and protecting whistleblowers. He's declared control over independent agencies such as the Federal Elections Commission. And he's gone after the arts and the media. Trump says he's the one who's saving American democracy. Yet his actions have raised alarms that the country's 240-year-old form of democratic government is under threat.
articles.title: Trump tests limits of executive power and US democracy

articles.author: Stella Martany
articles.description: The mountains of northern Iraq have for years been a sanctuary for Kurdish militants fighting a decades-long insurgency against the government in neighboring Turkey. Turkish airstrikes and ground incursions have targeting positions of the Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or PKK, inside Iraq. In the process, the attacks have also displaced thousands of Iraqi Kurdish villagers, cutting off many from their land. But now, these Iraqi Kurdish civilians hope a ceasefire declared by the PKK on Saturday will be implemented — possibly signaling an end to the 40-year conflict within Turkey — and that they will finally be able to go back to their homes and farms.
articles.title: Iraq's displaced Kurds hope to return home after Turkey's Kurdish militants declare a ceasefire

articles.author: Marcia Dunn
articles.description: A private lunar lander has touched down on the moon, delivering a drill and other experiments for NASA. Firefly Aerospace's Blue Ghost lander descended from lunar orbit Sunday, aiming for an impact basin on the moon's near side. Confirmation of touchdown came from Firefly's Mission Control in Texas. Named for a rare species of fireflies, Blue Ghost blasted off from Florida in January. Two other companies' landers are hot on its heels, with the next one targeting a landing later this week. The flurry comes as NASA strives to ignite a lunar economy and send astronauts back.
articles.title: Blue Ghost lunar lander successfully lands on moon with a special delivery for NASA

articles.author: Tia Goldenberg
articles.description: Hamas has accused Israel of trying to derail the fragile ceasefire in the Gaza Strip by embracing a new proposal to extend it. The militant group said Israel’s decision to cut off aid to the territory on Sunday amounted to “cheap extortion, a war crime and a blatant attack on the (ceasefire) agreement.”
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire: Israel stops entry of all aid and supplies into Gaza Strip
